snippet: The Obama administration sending more military power to Asia in part led to China seeking stronger military and economic relations with Russia, a country it has long regarded with suspicion.
abstract: Armada of Chinese and Russian warships sail in ceremonial formation in Sea of Japan, high point of joint naval exercises intended to show growing unity between two countries with historically uneasy relationship; Obama administration’s decision to send more military power to Asia has played a role in China's seeking stronger military and economic relations with Russia.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration sending more military power to Asia in part led to China seeking stronger military and economic relations with Russia, a country it has long regarded with suspicion.

headline.main: China and Russia, in a Display of Unity, Hold Naval Exercises
headline.print_headline: China and Russia, in a Display of Unity, Hold Naval Exercises
